Some of the levels might make you want to die but they are so fun and challenging! Great game!

The reason it’s a nearly perfect game is because the game just freezes when you touch the SS1 teleporter*. And sometimes after you quit a time trials, the screen goes black but you can still flip around. If those bugs weren’t in the game it would be a perfect game! Five stars!

*SS1 is Space Station 1, the first zone in the game. I only called it that because I speedrun this and that’s what speed runners call it. But other than that, a great game!

title.label: Best port of a game ever!

content.label: I played this game on my pc a couple years ago and a friend told me that it was on the App Store. I immediately bought it and have had endless fun with it. The plot is amazing and it’s challenging enough to get your brain thinking! 10/10

This is one of my favorite games available on iOS. The soundtrack is catchy and immersive and a great complement to the challenging gameplay. VVVVVV is very difficult but it’s replay-ability is high because it is so driven by the core mechanic of the game. I recommend this to anyone who loves challenging platformers.
Need more games like this
One of the best games I’ve ever played on iOS.
What do you mean by “64 bit”?
I love this game, but ever since I updated to iOS 11 the left direction sticks and my character moves on its own. Any fix?? I’ve tried changing control type and restarting the app but didn’t work.

PLZ ADD LEVEL EDITOR WITH TOOLBOX NOW!!!!!!!!!!!!!👾👾👾

MAKE MY DREAM COME TRUE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This is one of my favorite games of all time and unlike most mobile ports this is just as good as the console and PC versions. (Though it’s missing the level editor.) This game was difficult at first but I’ve beaten it a few times now so even things like Edge Games and Doing Things The Hard Way don’t give me too much trouble. Anyone who enjoys difficulty, which I do, will most likely have a blast with this game. The level design is great, the music is great, getting all the trinkets is fun, and it’s overall just an amazing game. I highly recommend it.

Haven’t played it in a few years, but the main game mechanic is  fantastic, and the C64 aesthetic is super clean. 

Was playing Super Hexagon wondering if VVVVV was ever updated for newer iOS systems and literally 8 minutes before I checked, it was. :) Thank you for this amazing game. Have a good day!

This is the best game I have ever played on iOS. I'm not much of iOS player as much as a computer player but this game got my attention. I got it for free at Starbucks and it has been my favorite game. 
 Although, there are some parts that are really hard or just mind games, don't give up, try everything, and if it doesn't work look it up on YouTube. Not gonna lie I had to do it 2 times. 

The best part of this game is that it needs no wifi so I can save my LTE while having fun.
I've been playing this game for about 2 weeks and I beat it!
Thanks for the 64 bit update! It is appreciated.

Dude, the fact that i beat this in a day kind of proves the game is easy. But it still kills time and that makes it a good thing to have on your mobile device. You can play it again and again and player levels are a blast! I truly reccomend this game!

title.label: Fun game but sound is a dealbreaker

content.label: The fact that you can't turn down the music in the game kills this game for me. I want to be able to listen to music or a podcast when I play and I can't.
I beat the game in 20 minutes.
Why can I not turn the sound off? I'd like to listen to podcasts while I play. This is the only game I have that doesn't have a sound option.

This is the best game I've ever downloaded. It is fun, easy-to-play-hard to-master. Plus, the music is great. It took me about 2.5 hrs to beat the game but there is still trinkets to find which unlock a hidden area.

title.label: I would completely recommend this game to anyone, this is one for the memories.

content.label: I very rarely find games like these. The ones that pull me in and keep me playing even if I have hit the same set of spikes on the same screen for the hundredth time. The ones that make me want to go out and get all of the collectibles, not only to say that I've done it, but to also see as much of the game as possible. This is a game that I remember screen for screen. I bought this during the %66 off indie sale and if I hadn't caught that deal then I would probably never have this game. It is very difficult, and you will spend 5-10 minutes on some screens. Even up to 30-60 for one or two trinket screens if you want them. But it's all worth it. This game doesn't other many hours the first play though. But with all the extra modes and all of the player made worlds it makes the game much longer. The only thing I can say is that I heavily hope that they come out with the VVVVVV: Make and Play edition for iOS. But beyond that it is worth every penny that it costs, even without the deal. And I hope that if anyone that gets the chance to try it takes that chance and plays through the game completely and fully, then you'll really start to understand how amazing this simple little game really is.
Not compatible with iPhone 6s hello? I'll give it five stars If you guys fix this

If you find yourself saying these same words, good luck, because the accuracy of the controls makes the mobile version more rage inducing than the original. Aside from that, it still manages to capture the amazing puzzle mechanics of the original version.

This game is HARD! But it's super fun and holds your attention!
Points:
• Easy to learn
• Hard to master
• Well worth the $$$
• Feel accomplished!

title.label: No updates ever? Very Dated. Boring

content.label: First message you get is a warning that this app will slow your iPhone down because the developers haven't updated it for nearly THREE YEARS. It's just barely compatible with the newest iOS. I understand it's supposed to look vintage, but the graphics are blurry. The game looks like a beginner made it and it's honestly not worth the $.99 I wasted on it because after 5 mins of playing, I'm bored out of my mind and ready to delete. I wish I could get a refund.
I love this game but after I saved violet every time I try to go through a portal it keeps freezing!! please fix this!!!

Amazing game with a really cool concept. Only tweaks needed are an option to turn off sound, and slighter easier to manage hitboxes for the button control mode.

I had first played this game on my DSi and I sold that for a 3DS like 5 years ago so seeing this on the App Store and being able to play it brings back memories since it was one of my absolute favorite ds game of all time

Worth every penny. You'll spend more than 40 minutes trying to get some shinys but it's worth every minute lol! So fun and frustrating but you'll eventually come out on top! Highly recommend !
I personally love this game. It is very compelling and enjoyable until the end, and even after that, I still had fun exploring in flip mode. However, this game really needs a level editor for IOS.
I LOVE THIS APP! But one thing. Can you add a part where you can make your own dimension? I thought you could do that when you beat the game but it didn't.
Fun storyline, just a great overall game.
The only mobile game I ever recommend to my friends. You haven't lived until you've died for the 757th time and thrown your phone across the room in frustration. Get it. 11/10

Personally, I spent 4h 45m with the game practically in a single sitting. It drew me in and kept my attention extremely well. That said, the game wasn't great for my sanity. Some of the rooms are designed in such a way that after solving them, you'll know you hate yourself for putting yourself through some torture for a shiny that seems to only unlock chip tunes. If V stands for death, the title of this game would be die die die die die die. The game claims I died 2600 times in 4.75 hours. The title of the game is a representation of the games worst enemy, the spikes, and also represents the manner in which you traverse the levels: Down up down up down up. I'd recommend the game if you like platformers and puzzles and you hate yourself. I couldn't put it down, but a significant portion of the game was frustration with only a short lived payoff of satisfaction.
the pc and 3ds versions of the game have it, so why shouldent this version?

Awesome game.
Very very frustrating.
But if you keep on trying you will eventually beat it. I beat it after dying like 2000 times.  Very fun if you never give up. Worth the money!

Amazing game enough to keep you busy for few days if you want to finish the hole thing; it could get very frustrating but it gets challenging as far as you go.
